main.name: Srushti Shah
main.description: Coding, books and music are my survival assets
main.bio: Welcome to my portfolio website! I am a Master of Engineering student majoring in Computer Engineering at New York University in the Big Apple. I have been learning to code since Grade 11 and know various programming languages like C, C++, JavaScript, PHP and Python. Frontend Web Development has been one of my major interests, and I have worked with HTML5, CSS, Javascript, Bootstrap, TailwindCSS, MaterialUI, React.js and NodeJS to build personal projects as well as for internship projects and interview tasks. Furthermore, I have managed to learn C#, .NET framework, and Visual Studio 2019 to build a desktop project as part of my internship with Space Applications Center, ISRO. Being an enthusiast for Artificial Intelligence, I strive to dive deep into the field and bring my ideas to life. Currently, I am taking up some intersting courses like Deep Learning, ML Systems Engineering and Operation, and Data Science for Business under some of the coolest professors! It would be right to call me a nerd, as I am ever-ready to code or read a book. After an exhausting day of work or study, I revitalize by enjoying mystery thriller books and Bollywood songs that incorporate Indian classical music.
main.contactmessage: Get in touch with me to know more!

work.title: React Development Intern
work.description: I worked on feature development for two client websites, focusing on enhancing UI and functionality. I collaborated on requirements and design, implemented features, and conducted unit and integration testing to ensure quality. Additionally, I contributed to design discussions and user acceptance testing, gaining hands-on experience with the full project lifecycle while working with cross-functional teams. This experience strengthened my skills in React.js, frontend development, and building user-friendly web applications.

work.company: Bhaskaracharya National Institute for Space Applications and Geo-informatics
work.title: Research Intern
work.description: I worked on analyzing air quality data from Indian cities spanning 2013 to 2022. I performed data preprocessing and exploratory analysis to prepare for predictive modeling and implemented machine learning algorithms, including Linear Regression, Decision Tree, and Neural Networks, to predict AQI trends. Additionally, I optimized model training by configuring CUDA and cuDNN for GPU acceleration. This experience deepened my understanding of data-driven insights, predictive analytics, and high-performance computing.

work.title: Research Intern
work.description: I developed a Windows desktop application for real-time monitoring of Quantum Key Distribution (QKD) metrics in the Quantum Communication department. I designed and implemented a user-friendly interface to track and display critical parameters, ensuring continuous observation and analysis. The project involved working with C# and XAML within the .NET 5.0 framework, enhancing my skills in software development for scientific applications, real-time data visualization, and system optimization.
